body.p: Initials are marked as a special TextRegion. This also applies if they have been heavily graphically alienated. They usually extend over several lines and it is predominantly the first letter of a paragraph which has been graphically designed or colored to stand out from the font of the text. In rare cases, whole words are designed as initials and are then recorded as such.

topic.title: Relationship between the Initial and the Following Paragraph

body.p: To document the relationshop between initial (<textRegion type="drop-cap">) and the following paragraph (<textRegion type="paragraph">), use the <Relations> element. After the <ReadingOrder> has been defined, the <Relations> element must be used to display the relationship between the regions.
